events.title: Britain's High Court says government illegally banned Pro-Palestinian group
events.summary: In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."

events.title: Who will police Gaza, and how?
events.summary: Under President Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan, Arab countries and the European Union are supposed to train a new police force in the Gaza Strip. But U.S. plans have run into serious challenges.

events.title: World leaders to discuss the future of Europe's security in Munich
events.summary: World leaders will meet at the Munich Security Conference Friday to discuss the future of Europe's security.

events.title: Members of Germany's far-right party to attend Munich Security Conference after ban
events.summary: Members of Germany's far-right AfD Party were banned from attending the Munich Security Conference. On Friday, they'll attend for the first time in years.

events.title: A historic election in Bangladesh brings BNP to power. What to know about its leader
events.summary: The Bangladeshi Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, claimed victory Friday in the first elections held since the previous government was toppled in a student-led revolution in 2024.

events.title: Israel accuses two of using military secrets to place Polymarket bets
events.summary: The Tel Aviv indictment is the first publicly known instance of people being accused of leveraging military secrets to place bets on the popular prediction market.

events.title: How U.S. sanctions played into the protests in IRan
events.summary: The protests in Iran have been about human rights, corruption, freedom — but they were sparked by economic hardship, caused in part by U.S. sanctions. How did they play into the events in Iran?

events.title: Germany's far right political party, the AFD, is at the Munich Security Conference
events.summary: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly and Correspondent Rob Schmitz discuss Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, at to the Munich Security Conference.

events.title: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative
events.summary: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative after President Trump's threats to take over Greenland.

events.title: Iranian exiles in Turkey scramble to find news from home
events.summary: Iranians living in Turkey are hearing chilling stories from relatives at home — and receiving death threats themselves.

events.title: Nigeria to hold presidential election in February 2027
events.summary: Amid public concern over the state of the economy, Nigeria is preparing for next year's elections. The country's election authority has set 20 February 2027 as the date for its next presidential and parliamentary polls.

events.title: Sex, health, child abuse scandals threaten Orban re-election
events.summary: Abuse in a juvenile facility, hazardous dust from a battery factory and an alleged sex video involving the opposition leader — the run-up to Hungary's election has so far been dominated by one scandal after another.

events.title: As the telephone turns 150, are we hanging up on phone calls?
events.summary: Today, 150 years after the invention of the telephone, it has never been easier to call someone. But in some ways, and for some people, picking up the phone is still a very hard thing to do.

events.title: Mehmet Oz's vaccine call is 'too little, too late'
events.summary: Measles is still spreading in the US but calls from government officials for Americans to vaccinate now won’t be enough to keep the country from losing a quarter-century of success eradicating the disease.

events.title: Sudan civil war: Ethiopia's, UAE's role under scrutiny
events.summary: A report by Reuters reveals that Ethiopia is hosting a facility used to train Sudan's RSF paramilitary forces, with backing from the UAE. The UN says the war has killed over 40,000 and displaced millions of people.

events.title: MSC: Germany's Merz says old world order 'no longer exists'
events.summary: The MSC brings together security experts, politicians and military leaders from around the world. This year's edition comes amid growing fears for trans-Atlantic security under US President Trump. Follow DW for more.

events.title: UK decision to ban Palestine Action unlawful, court rules
events.summary: The High Court's ruling comes after the pro-Palestinian group's co-founder launched a legal challenge against the ban. The ban, however, will remain in place while the government appeals.

events.title: Vladislav Heraskevych: 'It looks like this train has left'
events.summary: The skeleton racer looks to have failed in his bid to compete at the Winter Games. Vladislav Heraskevych had appealed to the CAS after the IOC banned him from competing with a helmet featuring killed Ukrainian athletes.

events.title: Germany: Security alert halts flights at Cologne/Bonn airport
events.summary: Cologne/Bonn Airport temporarily suspended outgoing passenger processing after police cleared the security area as a precaution. The alert, which has been lifted, followed the introduction of new screening technology.

events.title: 2 dead in South Carolina university shooting
events.summary: The university in the southern United States remained locked down for almost eight hours after the incident. Officials have not yet confirmed the victims' identities or whether anyone is in custody.

events.title: Bangladesh elections: BNP confidently wins landmark vote
events.summary: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party secured a clear majority of parliamentary seats in the country's landmark election, with party chairman, Tarique Rahman, set to become the next prime minister.

events.title: Trump drops key US climate rule, swaps health for cheap cars
events.summary: The US has revoked what's known as the endangerment finding, a scientific finding central to US climate actions, to boost cheaper, gas-powered cars. Experts say the shift comes at a fragile point for the warming planet.

events.title: Storm Nils batters France, Spain: 3 dead, thousands without power
events.summary: In southern France and northern Spain, the "unusually strong" storm Nils uprooted trees, flooded roads, and left thousands without power.

events.title: US lawmakers press Taiwan to boost defense spending amid China threat
events.summary: US lawmakers tell Taiwan's parliament threat from China "has never been greater." Meanwhile, Taipei inked a trade deal with the US to cut tariffs and deepen semiconductor and AI ties.

events.title: Germany news: Deutsche Bahn calls safety summit
events.summary: Safety on Germany's public transport network is a hot topic after a fatal attack on a train conductor earlier this month. About one in four Germans told a survey they felt unsafe on buses and trains. DW has more.

events.title: Japan seizes Chinese fishing vessel in a first since 2022
events.summary: Japan said it seized a Chinese fishing vessel and arrested its captain for allegedly fleeing inspection in the nation's exclusive economic zone. Here's why that matters.

events.title: Bangladesh: Tarique Rahman poised to be next PM
events.summary: Rahman returned to Bangladesh in December after more than 17 years of self-exile in London. Going into the vote, Rahman was confident he could secure enough votes to govern alone.

events.title: Wanted man arrested after he returns to watch the Olympics
events.summary: A Slovak national wanted by Italian police for 16 years for a series of thefts was arrested before he got to see his national ice hockey team perform at the Winter Olympics.

events.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa to deploy army to combat crime
events.summary: Organized crime is "the most immediate threat" to South Africa's democracy, President Cyril Ramaphosa said in his state of the nation address, pledging to use the military against criminals.

events.title: Switzerland to vote on capping population at 10 million
events.summary: A proposal by anti-immigration Swiss People's Party has gained enough signatures to head to a referendum this June. But lawmakers and business groups argue the move could cause economic chaos.

events.title: Germany braces for more strikes in 2026
events.summary: This year has already seen considerable industrial action and labor disputes in Germany. More strikes are expected in the aviation, train travel and chemicals industries.

events.title: Should the Berlinale film festival 'stay out of politics’?
events.summary: Asked if the Berlin International Film Festival should take a stand on Gaza, jury president Wim Wenders said it must "stay out of politics." Not everyone agrees.

events.title: YouTube, WhatsApp blocked in Russia
events.summary: More websites and messenger apps are becoming inaccessible in Russia. While users look for ways around government bans, others wonder what will ultimately remain of the internet.

events.title: France, Germany signal unity at EU's Belgium castle retreat
events.summary: Emmanuel Macron and Friedrich Merz greeted the press together on arrival at the Alden Biesen Castle, with Macron saying they shared a "sense of urgency" on economic reform. But the two may clash on the way forward.

events.title: Prague exhibition documents Slovak National Gallery decline
events.summary: A Prague exhibition called "Free National Gallery – Description of a Struggle" details the political dispute over culture in neighboring Slovakia under Robert Fico. It carries an implicit warning for Czech culture, too.

events.title: Germany's new plans to tackle spiralling rents
events.summary: Tenants in big cities like Berlin are being exploited by the use of legal loopholes to circumvent rent control laws. The government is now planning to introduce new rules for furnished and short-term rentals.

events.title: Brussels: Police search European Commission buildings
events.summary: Investigators have searched premises belonging to the European Commission in Brussels, with the operation reportedly tied to the sale of over 20 Commission buildings.

events.title: AI-fueled chip shortage drives up smartphone prices
events.summary: The era of cheap data storage is ending. Artificial intelligence is pushing chip prices higher and exacerbating supply shortages. Anyone buying a new smartphone in 2026 should brace for higher prices.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.summary: Harold Kreis is embarking on his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: First German politician enters Gaza since October 7 attack
events.summary: The speaker of the Bundestag, Julia Klöckner, entered as far as the so-called "Yellow Line" of predominantly Israeli control in Gaza. She held no talks with Palestinians, prompting some criticism at home.

events.title: 'Threat to world peace': How Germans see the US now
events.summary: Back in 2016, German trust in the United States was at all-time high. Today the situation could not be more different. This is mostly due to US President Donald Trump and his unpredictable policies.

events.title: Merkel calls speculation about German presidency bid 'absurd'
events.summary: The office of former Chancellor Angela Merkel has dismissed reports that she could be in the running to become Germany's next president. Political parties are weighing who might replace President Steinmeier next year.

events.title: Ukraine updates: NATO ministers to discuss support for Kyiv
events.summary: At their meeting in Brussels, NATO ministers will be joined by Ukrainian Defense Minister Mykhailo Fedorov for the first time since he took office in January. DW has more.

events.title: Germany news: Carnival security threat level remains high
events.summary: Police in Germany’s Carnival hotspots say they are on high alert, but point out there are no concrete security threats to this year’s celebrations. Meanwhile, carmaker Mercedes-Benz has seen profits halve. DW has more.

events.title: TikTok and beats: Cologne's famed Carnival has a new image
events.summary: Cologne's Carnival celebration has a new sound. Young music, viral hits and new costume trends are re-shaping the event. Carnival is more than just a tradition — it has secured itself a place in pop culture as well.

events.title: Germany's far-right AfD party accused of nepotism
events.summary: Turmoil has engulfed the far-right Alternative for Germany party (AfD). Allegations of nepotism and weak leadership are circulating, and influential officials warn the party is jeopardizing its election prospects.

events.title: Epstein files implicate Germany's Deutsche Bank
events.summary: The latest release of Epstein files show the late financier and convicted sex offender had up to 40 accounts with Deutsche Bank.

events.title: Ukraine athlete Heraskevych: 'My Olympic moment was stolen'
events.summary: Ukrainian skeleton athlete Vladyslav Heraskevych was disqualified from the Winter Games over his 'helmet of remembrance.' He has now appealed his case to the Court of Administation for Sport.

events.title: Olympics: Ukrainian athlete banned over 'political' helmet
events.summary: The IOC has disqualified Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych for wearing a helmet that features images of Ukrainian athletes killed during Russia's war on Ukraine.

events.title: Germany: Lufthansa strike grounds hundreds of flights
events.summary: Pilots and flight attendants at Germany's flag carrier are staging an all-day walkout. Lufthansa has called the action "a completely unnecessary" escalation.

events.title: Germany's Deutsche Bahn halts humorous publicity campaign
events.summary: German Rail was once famed for its punctuality. But chronic delays, frequent cancellations, poor in-train services and rising ticket prices have dogged its reputation. And a humorous PR campaign has not helped.

events.title: EU ups drone cooperation amid hybrid threats
events.summary: The EU is increasing its efforts in drone security following multiple drone incursions into EU airspace in 2025. The new action plan aims to improve cooperation, but Europe’s drone security network remains patchy.

events.title: Germany: Tesla charges trade union member in IG Metall fight
events.summary: Tesla's German factory in Grünheide is pressing charges against an external trade union member. The company said he was caught recording a confidential meeting without permission; the IG Metall union called this a lie.

events.title: NATO begins 'Arctic Sentry' mission to secure region
events.summary: Through the "Arctic Sentry" mission, NATO is bolstering its military presence in the Arctic in an effort to de-escalate the conflict over Greenland.

events.title: Greenland's Olympic siblings keen to help protect homeland
events.summary: Sondre and Ukaleq Slettemark usually make up Greenland's biathlon team, despite a lack of facilities. But they are competing for Denmark at the Winter Olympics and, unlike Donald Trump, they want it to stay that way.

events.title: Berlinale film festival blends politics, pop culture
events.summary: An Afghan feature opens the Berlin International Film Festival, while stars including Pamela Anderson, Ethan Hawke and John Turturro are expected on the red carpet.

events.title: Berlinale 2026 honors Michelle Yeoh, icon of cinema
events.summary: Recognized with the Honorary Golden Bear in Berlin, the Malaysian actor became the first Asian woman to receive an Oscar, in 2023 for her role in "Everything Everywhere All at Once."

events.title: Olympics T-shirt marking 1936 Berlin Games raises eyebrows
events.summary: T-shirts on the Olympics online store commemorating past venues include one for the 1936 Games in Berlin. Nazi Germany hosted both the Winter and Summer Olympics that year, as it was starting to ramp up its repression.

events.title: EU needs capital market reform, simpler regulations, von der Leyen says
events.summary: The European Union needs to "tear down the barriers" if it wants to become a truly global economic giant, the European Commission chief said.

events.title: Samer Tawk: From intensive care to Winter Olympic return
events.summary: In 2018, Samer Tawk became the first athlete to represent Lebanon in cross-country skiing at the Winter Olympics. A year later, he was lying in a hospital bed wondering if he would ever walk again.

events.title: German government pushes Syrians to return to their homeland
events.summary: Nearly 6,000 Syrians in Germany applied for voluntary return to Syria in 2025. But with security concerns lingering and reconstruction slow, Syria remains too unstable for most refugees to consider going back.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Zelenskyy says ceasefire must precede vote
events.summary: Ukraine's president pushed back after a media report suggesting an election could be announced later this month. Meanwhile, the European Parliament approved a €90 billion loan for Ukraine. DW has more.

events.title: Lufthansa pilots, crew to strike on Thursday
events.summary: Lufthansa passengers should expect disruption and possible cancellations. A pilots' trade union has called a 24-hour strike amid a dispute over pension payments.

events.title: Germany logs rising rate of crimes against journalists
events.summary: A total of 818 crimes against journalists or media were reported to Germany's investigative federal police force between April 2024 and November 2025. Just over 10% of them were violent in nature.

events.title: Epstein files: Germany scrutinizes newly released documents
events.summary: The scandal surrounding US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is rocking European countries. In Germany, journalists are combing through the files, and politicians are pushing for investigations.

events.title: Ukraine's Olympic skater has dad and country front of mind
events.summary: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has torn Kyrylo Marsak from his family, but the figure skater has found a particular way to keep his father in mind. The presence of a Russian athete in his event is a source of disquiet.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Europe to set its demands for Russia in peace talks
events.summary: The EU's Kaja Kallas signals a tougher EU line on Russia in potential peace negotiations. Meanwhile, the Kremlin says it is ready for dialogue with French President Emmanuel Macron. Follow DW for more.

events.title: The German Olympic ski jump winner with a fear of heights
events.summary: German ski jumper Philipp Raimund hasn't won a single World Cup event. That's just part of what makes his Olympic gold medal performance so incredible.

events.title: Italy: Rai sports staff to strike over Olympic opening farce
events.summary: RaiSport's director gave himself the announcer's job for the Winter Olympics opening ceremony and then proceeded to botch it. Staff have announced a strike in protest to begin once the Games are finished.

events.title: Is Netflix making us stupid?
events.summary: Netflix is increasingly designing films and series for distracted, second-screen viewers. DW's Scott Roxborough asks what it means for storytelling, visual language and the future of cinema as an art form.

events.title: IOC bars Ukrainian skeleton racer from wearing memorial helmet at Olympics
events.summary: Ukraine's bid to let skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych use a helmet honoring athletes killed in the war with Russia has been rejected by the International Olympic Committee.

events.title: Slovakia's embattled LGBTQ+ community hopes for change
events.summary: New restrictive legislation in Slovakia comes despite rising public acceptance of same-sex couples, making the situation for the LGBTQ+ community complex and contradictory.

events.title: Macron warns Europe faces political and economic crisis
events.summary: The French president urged EU leaders to confront competition from the US and China and back a "Made in Europe" strategy.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin releases report on hidden violence
events.summary: Germany has released its first report on violence that goes unreported, both behind closed doors and in public. Meanwhile, a series of so-called "warning strikes" is being staged by public sector unions.

events.title: Germany: Queer referee attacked after viral proposal
events.summary: Referee Pascal Kaiser went viral after proposing to his boyfriend during a Bundesliga game. Then, the 27-year-old was attacked, though the motive is still unclear.

events.title: Corruption watchdog reports increase in global graft
events.summary: Once seen as anti-graft strongholds, the US, UK, Canada and Sweden are slipping into decline due to a lack of political leadership, Transparency International's Corruption Perception Index has revealed.

events.title: US, Armenia sign nuclear deal during Vance visit
events.summary: During a visit by Vice President JD Vance, the US and Armenia agreed to cooperate in the civil nuclear sector. Vance will also travel to Azerbaijan, hoping to finalize a peace deal.

events.title: MSC braces for more of Trump's 'wrecking-ball politics'
events.summary: Chairman Wolfgang Ischinger tells DW the 2026 Munich Security Conference comes when "obviously, trust has been damaged" by President Trump. But he also says US calls for a more "self-reliant" Europe are fair and overdue.

events.title: UK: Keir Starmer clings on, party ally calls on him to quit
events.summary: The Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar has called on Starmer to quit. But the PM says he has no intention of stepping down, even as a second top aide in as many days falls on his sword.

events.title: Germany's gas reserves face crucial energy supply test
events.summary: The country's stockpiles have dropped to about 30% amid a spell of severe cold. Will supplies hold up?

events.title: Nature: the economy's secret lifeline?
events.summary: New global research exposes the business–nature link we can’t afford to ignore — plus the playbook for fixing it.

events.title: Germany's neoliberal FDP: No chance for a comeback?
events.summary: The neoliberal Free Democratic Party played a decisive role in shaping politics in Germany. After a wipeout in the last federal election, the party is fighting for survival ahead of important state elections.

events.title: Super Bowl 2026: Seattle Seahawks beat New England Patriots
events.summary: The Seattle Seahawks have defeated the New England Patriots in the NFL's showpiece event, with Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny making history by performing the halftime show in Spanish.

events.title: Fake Berlin Wall fragments on sale as souvenirs?
events.summary: It's been nearly 40 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall but you can still buy pieces of it in the German capital as souvenirs. Are they the real deal?

events.title: Why scientists warn of privately funded geoengineering
events.summary: As the climate crisis intensifies, interest in solar engineering is increasing, including among private companies and investors. But the technique is controversial and lacks regulation.

events.title: How the Epstein-Barr virus triggers MS in some people
events.summary: Multiple sclerosis is also caused by a virus carried by almost all humans. A new study provides an explanation as to why only certain people develop the disease. This also opens up the possibility of a treatment.

events.title: Germans increasingly concerned over social inequality
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his conservatives have seen a dip in the polls. This follows weeks of debates over the latest controversial proposals to restructure Germany's welfare state.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony — as it happened
events.summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony is finally here. DW followed the official opening to the 25th edition of the games live in Milan.

events.title: German train conductor's death highlights rise in violence
events.summary: Following a fatal attack on a railway employee, a debate has erupted in Germany about how such incidents can be prevented.

events.title: Women's Bundesliga dispute shows no sign of ending
events.summary: The future of women’s football in Germany remains in limbo, with the country’s top league and its association (DFB) wrestling for control. Germany's top clubs are refusing to work with the DFB, at least for now.

events.title: China grows while Europe slows in South American EV market
events.summary: China's electric carmakers are rapidly expanding across South America as Europe hesitates with trade liberalization. From Brazil to Argentina, a high-stakes battle is unfolding for the region's future auto market.

events.title: Cycle syncing exercise could optimize results for women
events.summary: Women in gyms hear it all the time: lift heavy in some weeks, go lighter in others, depending on your menstrual cycle — because your hormones affect your strength. But is it backed by science?

events.title: The fight for American football in Europe
events.summary: After the fall of the European League of Football, two rival organizations have emerged to fill the gap. Can they succeed where others, including the NFL, failed?

events.title: Trump to be exposed at Cologne Carnival's Rose Monday parade
events.summary: Donald Trump, Friedrich Merz and Emmanuel Macron are all targets of satirical floats at this year's Rose Monday Parade in Cologne. But Vladimir Putin will be spared — and there is a reason for that.

events.title: How US Project Vault challenges China's rare-earth dominance
events.summary: Donald Trump's Project Vault seeks to secure US access to rare earth minerals vital for advanced tech and clean energy. The EU wants a minerals alliance with Washington, but can they really shift China's outsized lead?

events.title: Winter Olympics begin quietly with curling
events.summary: The mixed doubles curling event kicked off the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics two days before the official opening of the Games.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: What you need to know
events.summary: This Friday, the 25th Winter Olympics will open in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. How big will the Games be? Will Russia be allowed to participate in the competitions — and what about security and doping?

events.title: World Cancer Day: Smoking, infections and alcohol cause 4 in 10 preventable cancer cases
events.summary: A new WHO study suggests that over 7 million cases of cancer in 2022 were preventable. Nearly 40% of all the cases that year were linked to modifiable risk factors — behavioral and environmental factors we can change.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.summary: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Tackling forever chemicals could save money and our health
events.summary: Critics say a new UK plan to tackle forever chemicals does not match proposed measures in the EU. As European governments try to deal with the growing PFAS pollution, cleaning it up could cost up to €1.7 trillion.

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.summary: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies — and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails
events.summary: Katie Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied the chance to reach her sixth Winter Olympics by rivals Canada. The top sports court has now blocked the US skeleton athlete's latest effort to compete.

events.title: FIFA boss Infantino wants Russia to return to football
events.summary: In a surprise statement, the head of world football has said he believes it is time for Russia to return to the pitch.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.summary: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Why gold and silver prices suddenly collapsed
events.summary: After hitting record highs last week, the prices of gold and silver have suddenly reversed course. DW looks at how a euphoric rally flipped into a sharp, confidence-shaking rout.

events.title: Vienna swaps parking for green space
events.summary: Conscious of reaching climate goals and strapped for space, some cities are reconsidering how much they dedicate to parking. Austria's capital, Vienna, is streets ahead.

events.title: Trump's Greenland 'piece of ice' remark echoes history
events.summary: Donald Trump's description of Greenland echoes a colonial pattern in which powerful states have dismissed sparsely populated land, ignoring Indigenous ties.

events.title: Handball: Germany lose to Denmark in Euro final
events.summary: Germany fell at the final hurdle at the European Men's Handball Championship, losing to co-hosts and favorites Denmark in the final. Two German players made the tournament all-star team.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Fun events, but what about the bill?
events.summary: Preparations for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina have been far from perfect. Should the Olympics hosting model be changed?

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.summary: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.summary: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.summary: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.summary: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.summary: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.summary: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.summary: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: Gold breaks $5,000: What's fueling the price rally and where will it end?
events.summary: Gold continues to hit record highs, having already had a bumper run in 2025. Geopolitical and economic uncertainty are the key factors, while doubts over the US dollar are also attracting new investors.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: 'Keep Europe strong from the inside': Kata Tütto, president of the Committee of the Regions
events.summary: Europe's regions are in danger of being squeezed as the EU considers sweeping changes to the way its 27 member states spend their money, warns the European official tasked with reducing inequalities among the bloc's hundreds of towns and regions.

events.title: Are teenagers too young to scroll? Europe weighs social media bans for minors
events.summary: Worries that too much time on social media may be hurting children's mental health, and creating addictions as harmful as alcohol or cigarettes, are sparking growing calls across Europe to block minors under the age of 15 or 16 from access to platforms.

events.title: At the Munich security summit, a push to rebuild Western unity
events.summary: Leaders are gathering at the Munich Security Conference as transatlantic relations remain under close scrutiny. This year, the United States is represented by Marco Rubio, whose early remarks suggest a more conciliatory and cooperative tone toward European allies. That contrasts with the impact of last year’s speech by JD Vance, which strongly criticised EU policies and unsettled European leaders. In their statements, European leaders are showing a willingness to rebuild transatlantic relations, as analysed by our journalist Kethevane Gorjestani.

events.title: Italy: 'Virgin' frescoes emerge from Pompeii suburb
events.summary: Visitors have begun entering the restored Villa Poppaea, a luxury Roman residence near Pompeii, where new frescoes and artworks are being uncovered after centuries buried by the 79 AD eruption of Mount Vesuvius. The villa, once home to Poppaea Sabina, wife of Nero, is revealing vivid decorations, including a peacock fresco linked to the Roman goddess Juno, as conservation work nears completion.

events.title: '100% recommend!' Malaysian Olympic skier Aruwin Salehhuddin shares her love of winter sports
events.summary: As plenty of drama plays out on the slopes of the Milano-Cortina Olympics, Malaysian alpine skier Aruwin Salehhuddin is giving it her all as the only athlete representing her country. From the Olympic Village, she shares her excitement and pride with Yuka Royer, and speaks about her dream of spreading winter sports in Southeast Asia.

events.title: February's unmissable TV: Steamy gay hockey, 'America's Next Top Model' controversy and more
events.summary: February is delivering a packed slate of must-watch television. Critic Dheepthika Laurent reviews the French release of "Heated Rivalry", which brings a steamy, taboo-breaking hockey romance to new audiences, as well as the Netflix show that revisits the legacy and controversies of "America's Next Top Model". Legal drama fans can dive into a high-stakes new season of "The Lincoln Lawyer", with Mickey Haller facing his toughest case yet – his own.

events.title: Successful blast-off for French astronaut Sophie Adenot
events.summary: Four astronauts blasted off from Cape Canaveral on Friday on a 34-hour space flight to the International Space Station (ISS). Among them is Sophie Adenot, who becomes just the second Frenchwoman to head into space after Claudie Haigneré achieved the feat in 1996 and 2001.

events.title: When Haute Couture breaks with tradition: Summer 2026 collections
events.summary: Across the discipline, designers are breathing fresh perspectives into Haute Couture. Kevin Germanier repurposes Berluti outfits worn by the French Olympic team. Stéphane Rolland encourages model Farnoush Hamidian to talk out about her native Iran. Julien Fournié extols the virtues of diversity. Yuima Nakazato battles AI with dresses made of ceramics. Charlie le Mindu makes masterpieces from hair. Finally, Imane Ayissi expresses his African identity through an unveiling of the creative process.

events.title: Texas, a health battleground: US state sees clash between science and politics
events.summary: Ever since Donald Trump's return to the White House and the appointment of Robert F. Kennedy Jr as Secretary of Health, the United States has become the scene of a growing clash between science and politics. One field in particular is paying the price of this ideological battle: health. FRANCE 24's Pierrick Leurent and Valerie Defert report from Texas.

events.title: Cash-strapped French hospitals appeal to public to help fund medicines, devices
events.summary: A growing number of French hospitals struggling with their finances are appealing to the public to help fund urgent needs like medicines and medical devices, and in one case even beds. While some have opted to offer so-called "citizen loans", others have turned to donations and company sponsorships.

events.title: Paris's Cité des Sciences soars with excitement over Crew‑12 launch
events.summary: The Cité des Sciences in Paris watched the Crew‑12 launch with excitement as astronauts headed to the ISS. Raphael Liégois, French astronaut, shared his insights on the mission with France 24’s Claire Paccalin, highlighting the thrill and significance of the lift‑off.

events.title: Who is Tarique Rahman, Bangladesh's election winner ?
events.summary: Bangladesh’s BNP wins a decisive majority, with Tarique Rahman set to lead after the 2024 uprising ousted Sheikh Hasina. Returning from 17 years abroad, he pledges unity, aid expansion, and political reforms.

events.title: From Haigneré to Adenot: The story of French astronauts
events.summary: French astronaut Sophie Adenot has just taken off to become the second French woman in space, 30 years after Claudie Haigneré, embarking on a nine-month mission aboard the ISS—the longest ever French spaceflight. Her journey is the latest chapter in France’s history of astronauts, from Jean-Loup Chrétien in 1982 to Thomas Pesquet, inspiring a new generation of explorers. Adenot reflects on the legacy of French space pioneers and the excitement of sharing this mission with the public.

events.title: Marco Rubio leads US delegation with warmer tone at Munich summit
events.summary: The Munich Security Conference opens in Munich, Germany, with EU‑US relations and NATO cooperation at the forefront after US tensions over Greenland and Ukraine. Secretary of State Marco Rubio leads the US delegation with a warmer, more reassuring tone than JD Vance's last year, while talks will also cover European defence and global security challenges.

events.title: One small step for women in space, one giant leap for equality
events.summary: With French female astronaut Sophie Adenot joining the crew at the International Space Station, it is the perfect moment to reflect on the role of women in space; a field still very much dominated by men. Yet years before Adenot set her sights on a career in space, other women were actively involved in the sector. But despite their achievements in computing, engineering and even on board the launches, many of their names have been forgotten by history. Annette Young also talks to Meganne Christian, a fellow British-Australian astronaut who’s been training with Adenot, on gender differences in space.

events.title: 'I'll rip your head off': Gang's grip over gold mines sows terror in Peru's La Pampa
events.summary: Peru's Guardianes de la Trocha gang has taken over La Pampa, a gold-rich area running alongside the Tambopata National Reserve, one of the most biodiverse regions on the continent. Forbidden Stories and its partner Mongabay Latam reveal how this criminal organisation spreads terror, silencing any opposition with the help of rising corruption in the country.

events.title: Macron calls for 'mandatory electoral bans' for people guilty of anti-Semitic or racist acts
events.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday called for those found guilty of anti-Semitic or racist acts or remarks to receive "mandatory electoral bans". Macron was speaking on the 20-year anniversary of the kidnapping, torture and murder of French Jewish man Ilan Halimi.

events.title: Iran crackdown: At least 200 children killed, schools under pressure
events.summary: The recent crackdown in Iran has left more than 7,000 people dead, including at least 200 children, with documentation slowed by internet shutdowns and restrictions on expert access. Shiva Amelirad, representative of the Coordinating Council of Iranian Teachers Trade Association, explains how the regime’s control over schools and discussions affects students and teachers, and the psychological impact of the violence.

events.title: 'Dhaka seems ready for a reset': Rudabeh Shahid on Bangladesh election
events.summary: As polls close in Bangladesh’s landmark general election, experts weigh in on the country’s future and high stakes. Rudabeh Shahid, Atlantic Council nonresident senior fellow on South Asia, discusses the impact of the 2024 Gen Z protests and the three-block political contest shaping the nation’s next government, also exploring Bangladeshi society, international relations, citizens’ hopes, and the challenges of reshaping the country after 17 years of authoritarian rule.

events.title: Replay: International crew takes off for space station
events.summary: Rewatch live our special segment on the take off of international crew, including France's Sophie Adenot, for a 9-month mission to the ISS on February 13, 2026.

events.title: Facial recognition: ICE agents use app to scan US citizens and immigrants
events.summary: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents are using a new facial recognition smartphone app called Mobile Fortify to scan the faces of both US citizens and immigrants. They point a phone camera at their target and it pulls up the person's immigration status. Previously reserved for use at US borders or criminal investigations, the technology is causing concern among civil rights advocates, who fear widespread digital surveillance on American streets.

events.title: 'A born astronaut': France's Sophie Adenot makes history with flight to space
events.summary: France's Sophie Adenot became only the second French woman to fly to space on Friday as her crew of four rocketed towards the International Space Station for an eight-month mission on board the orbiting laboratory, where a medical evacuation earlier this year left a skeleton crew of just three astronauts.

events.title: #Minnesota: #ICE drawdown under way as crackdown set to end
events.summary: After thousands of arrests, fatal shootings and fierce protests, the massive #immigration crackdown in #Minnesota is coming to an end, according to US border czar Tom Homan, with a drawdown of #ICE agents already underway.

events.title: Where to next for AI? The farm? The Church, even?
events.summary: PRESS REVIEW – Friday, February 13: The European press comes down hard on the IOC's decision to disqualify Ukraine's Vladyslav Heraskevych over his helmet. Also, we look at new and unexpected applications of artificial intelligence, as well as its colossal water and energy cost. Finally, we bring you the latest in the world of love, in the countdown to Valentine's Day.

events.title: There's no hiding the schism that now lies between Trump and Israel
events.summary: In the Middle East, nothing is ever straightforward, and so it was.

events.title: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party wins majority in historic election
events.summary: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.

events.title: Epstein's victims feared he secretly filmed them - emails suggest they were right
events.summary: Sky News has found an email exchange from 2014 showing that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein asked a member of staff to install hidden video cameras at his home in Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: The most striking pictures of the week
Storm Nils kills two in France - as hundreds of thousands still without power
events.summary: Storm Nils has killed two people in France, with around 450,000 people still without power as of Friday morning.

events.title: Bollywood and the mafia: A toxic and deadly affair
events.summary: A nexus between Bollywood and the Mafia, a one-sided toxic and deadly affair – with just one winner.

events.title: Who is Kim Ju Ae? The teenager who could be North Korea's next leader
events.summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is appearing to take steps to name his daughter as his official successor.

events.title: Who is Matt Weston? The athlete going for Team GB's first gold at Winter Olympics
events.summary: Going into the men's singles skeleton final, Team GB's Matt Weston is in prime position to win the UK's first medal at this year's games.

events.title: Defend yourselves and don't rely on the US, senior Washington official tells Europe
events.summary: Europe must take the lead in defending itself as the world becomes more militarised, but the US is not abandoning its NATO allies, a top American official has said.

events.title: Call to make NATO 'more European' - as key figure misses alliance summit
events.summary: Pete Hegseth, the US Secretary of War, is "missing a good party" by choosing to skip a meeting of his fellow NATO defence ministers in Brussels, one ally has said.

events.title: Logistics giant DP World replaces chairman named in Jeffrey Epstein documents
events.summary: Dubai has named a new chairman for DP World, one of the world’s largest logistics companies, replacing a chairman named in the Jeffrey Epstein files

events.title: Thailand’s ruling conservative party moves closer to forming new coalition government
events.summary: Thailand’s Bhumjaithai Party has moved closer to forming a new government after the Pheu Thai Party agreed to join it in a proposed coalition

events.title: UK court says government acted illegally in outlawing protest group Palestine Action

events.title: Ecuadorian leaves, Argentine protests and other top photos from Latin America and the Caribbean
events.summary:
Feb. 6-12, 2026

Ramon Pucha demonstrated how to turn a leaf into a hat to protect himself from the sun while looking for seeds to grow on his family’s farm, where he preserves native species and shares seedlings with neighboring communities in an effort to protect biodiversity, in Ecuador’s Amazon region. Students led a march on National Youth Day in Caracas, Venezuela, to call for the release of detainees who are considered political prisoners by their relatives and human rights groups. Workers mobilized by trade unions converged in a Buenos Aires square, blocking traffic and clashing with police as Argentina’s Senate debated and ultimately approved a labor overhaul.

This gallery was curated by photographer Esteban Felix, based in Santiago, Chile.

events.title: Prosecutors seek to drop charges against men accused of assaulting federal agents in Minneapolis
events.summary: A federal prosecutor is seeking to dismiss charges against two men involved in what authorities described as a violent altercation with immigration agents in Minneapolis last month.

events.title: An artist, a geophysicist and a fruit seller: Accounts of Iran's brutal crackdown emerge
events.summary: With Iran still reeling from a brutal crackdown on protests, details about victims are trickling out and the world is gradually getting a clearer picture of the violence used.

events.title: Why the Epstein scandal is Keir Starmer's most perilous moment yet after chief of staff resigns
events.summary: LONDON — Keir Starmer is facing what could be the most precarious moment of his time as Britain’s prime minister, as the global scandal surrounding Jeffrey Epstein envelops his government

events.title: Some Iranians rally behind the regime, but public anger runs deep after protest crackdown
events.summary: Supporters of Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, rallied to support him in Tehran this walks as talks took place with the U.S.

events.title: Key U.S.-Russia treaty expires, ushering in an era without caps on nuclear weapons
events.summary: The last major nuclear arms control treaty between Russia and the United States expires Thursday, ushering in an era without caps set by the world’s largest nuclear powers

events.title: Epstein emails bring scandal to Europe's elite, from Norway's crown princess to Britain's 'prince of darkness'
events.summary: A rare royal apology, resignations and allegations of leaked government intel: The release of new Epstein documents has provoked outrage and a demand for answers in Europe over ties between prominent figures and the disgraced financier.

events.title: Venezuelan university students say there’s hope amid ongoing fears, uncertainty
events.summary: In Caracas’ Central University, young Venezuelans explained why they’re cautiously willing to be part of their country’s ongoing discussions despite existing tensions.

events.title: First Americans to win silver in mixed doubles curling speak about the match
events.summary: Olympians Cory Thiesse and Korey Dropkin became the first Americans to win silver in mixed doubles curling and joined NBC News to talk their high-stakes match at 2026 Winter Games. The duo also spoke about how curling has increased in popularity over the years. Watch the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics on NBC and streaming on Peacock.

events.title: Nine people killed in a mass shooting involving a school in British Columbia
events.summary: Seven people were fatally shot at a school in British Columbia, while two others were found dead at a residence believed to be connected to the campus shooting. The suspected shooter was also found dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound. The motive surrounding the shooting is still being investigated.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Second U.S. aircraft carrier is being sent to the Middle East as Iran tensions remain high
events.summary: The USS Ford Carrier Strike Group has been notified that they are leaving the Caribbean and headed to the Middle East, according to two U.S. officials familiar with the decision.

events.title: 2 Israelis charged with using classified information to bet on Polymarket
events.summary: TEL AVIV — Two Israelis have been charged in connection with the suspected use of classified information to place bets on the prediction platform Polymarket, authorities said Thursday

events.title: Businessman named in Jeffrey Epstein files replaced as chairman of major logistics company
events.summary: Dubai has named a new chairman for DP World, one of the world’s largest logistics companies, replacing the outgoing head who was named in the Jeffrey Epstein documents

events.title: CIA makes new push to recruit spies from Chinese military
events.summary: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.

events.title: AOC to offer a 'working class' perspective on U.S. foreign policy at Munich summit
events.summary: Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez to offer foreign policy vision at the Munich Security Conference as speculation grows about a presidential or Senate run.

events.title: Canadian separatists optimistic after meetings with Trump officials
events.summary: Leaders of a right-wing separatist movement in Canada say they’ve discussed switching over to U.S. currency and creating a new military in conversations with U.S. officials.

events.title: Nicolás Maduro is the 'legitimate president' of Venezuela, acting leader says
events.summary: Nicolás Maduro is still the legitimate leader of Venezuela, the country's acting president said in an exclusive interview with NBC News.“I can tell you President Nicolás Maduro is the legitimate president.

events.title: Shooter in mass killing in Canada was a troubled teenager, police say
events.summary: The person accused of fatally shooting eight people and injuring two dozen more in the tiny Canadian town of Tumbler Ridge was identified by police Wednesday as Jesse Van Rootselaar, 18

events.title: U.K. police consult criminal prosecutors about Andrew-Epstein allegations
events.summary: British police said Wednesday they had spoken with specialist prosecutors as part of an ongoing assessment of allegations that former Prince Andrew shared confidential documents with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Venezuelans rally more openly as they navigate changing political landscape
events.summary: As people participate in more protests, they’re demanding the government release political prisoners as it has pledged to do.

events.title: Iran rules out broader U.S. talks as Trump hints at sending 2nd carrier
events.summary: Iran insisted Wednesday that it was willing to negotiate with the United States over its nuclear program, but it ruled out broader talks at a pivotal moment in diplomacy between Washington and Tehran

events.title: King Charles ready to help police as they assess claims Andrew shared sensitive info with Epstein
events.summary: British police are looking into a claim that former Prince Andrew shared confidential trade documents with disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein while serving as a U.K. trade envoy

events.title: Hong Kong democracy activist Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in prison
events.summary: Hong Kong pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai is set to be sentenced Monday after his conviction in a landmark national security trial.

events.title: Russia detains suspect in senior general's shooting, blames Ukraine
events.summary: The FSB, Russia’s powerful security service, has blamed its Ukrainian counterpart of orchestrating the shooting of a senior military intelligence agency official after it said it had detained a suspect in the attack.

events.title: Japan's Sanae Takaichi wins a supermajority after gambling on a snap election
events.summary: Japan’s conservative prime minister Sanae Takaichi has won a landslide victory after she gambled on a high-stakes snap election

events.title: In Ukraine talks, Trump deploys a familiar foreign policy tool: a ticking clock
events.summary: President Donald Trump has set another deadline, according to Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who said the U.S. wants a deal by June to bring an end to Russia's war.
